moves.1. d4: In this game I won a couple pawn and traded down into a won endgame.
moves.1... d5 2. c4 dxc4 3. e3 Nf6 4. Bxc4 e6: Standard to cut down my bishop's diagonal.
moves.5. Nc3 Bb4 6. Qa4+: Not great, this a trappy move where you hope he won't notice Nc6, I don't know what I was thinking with this.
moves.7... Bxc3+ 8. bxc3 Bd7 9. Ba3: Much better than b2, this takes a long diagonal and prevents castling.
moves.13... Nxc5 14. Qxc5: White has a huge advantage, his queen is well centralized, he has a strong center and he is up a pawn.
moves.15. Qxc7 O-O 16. O-O: I finally castle. White has a near winning advantage.
moves.19... Rxd7 20. Rfb1: I think I should have moved the other rook.
moves.20... Rd5 21. Qb4 Qxb4: ? I wouldn't have done this, it simplifies even more.
moves.22. Rxb4 Rc8 23. Rab1: If he *really* wants to he can take my pawn...
moves.24... Rxb8 25. Rxb8+ Kh7 26. f4: I now have a won game.
moves.26... Ra5 27. Rb7 Rxa2 28. Rxf7: Pawn trade, it does give him a passed pawn, but it gives him an isolated pawn and gets rid of one of my isolated pawns.
moves.36... Re1+ 37. Kd4 Rh1 38. Ra2 g4 39. d6: Nothing he can do to stop it.
moves.40. Rd2: If I had moved my pawn again then he could have skewered my king and pawn.
moves.52... Kh3 53. Kg6: If he takes my pawn then it's just a simple matter of king and rook VS king. He resigns. Please comment and rate.
